Name: Riga
Description: Riga is the financial, creative, and cultural center of Latvia. It is the capital and the largest city in Latvia, it is also the largest city in the Baltic States. The city lies on the Gulf of Riga, at the mouth of Daugava, Riga has an population of about 640,000 inhabitants (2015). It is home to one in three Latvians. Part of many empires throughout history, each of which has left its mark on the city, today Riga is a city with many faces. It is famous for Art Nouveau and wooden architecture. Riga's historical center is listed as UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: Sigulda
Description: Sigulda is administratively in the Riga region, however culturally a part of the Vidzeme region.

Name: Cēsis
Description: Cēsis (Livonian: Venden, German: Wenden) is a town in Gauja National Park, in the Vidzeme region of Latvia, located on the Gauja river, roughly 100 km to the east of the capital Riga..

Name: Jūrmala
Description: Jūrmala is a resort town in Latvia. It claims to have the longest beach in Northern Europe.

Name: Daugavpils
Description: Daugavpils is the second largest city in Latvia, after Riga.

Name: Ventspils
Description: Ventspils is a city in Kurzeme on the western coast of Latvia and one of Europe's busiest ports.

Name: Liepāja
Description: Liepāja (pronounced lee-ah-pa-yah) is a city on Latvia's Baltic coast.

Name: Kuldīga
Description: Kuldiga (Kuldīga) is a town on the Venta River in the Kurzeme region (formerly Courland) of western Latvia.

Name: Madona
Description: Madona is a town in the center of eastern Latvia, in the eastern part of the Vidzeme region.
